tooltip.wxmod.block.midland_wr100:
§b§oFirst released in 2002 with a 10 year lifespan, 
The Midland WR100 was one of the most successful 
and common weather radios on the market. 
It had 5 different variants with changes to the 
faceplate, LED lights, menu options, etc.
tooltip.wxmod.block.midland_wr100bns:
§b§oThe Black and Silver is the first and rarest 
variant of the Midland WR100 that debuted in 2002. 
It was only produced in clam-shell packaging and only came 
in a V1 or V2 PCB. Black and Silvers were discontinued 
1 year later in 2003.
tooltip.wxmod.block.midland_wr300:
§b§oFirst introduced in 2002 alongside the WR100, 
It would go on to be another very popular radio created 
by Midland and contained additional features than the WR100. 
As of 2022, The Midland WR300 is still manufactured in stores.
tooltip.wxmod.block.uniden_wx500:
§b§oThe WX500 was released 
to consumers in 2002 
according to it's user manual. 
It was manufactured for only 2 years 
between 2002-2004, making this radio 
a fairly rare find.
tooltip.wxmod.block.uniden_wx100:
§b§oThe Uniden Bearcat WX100 was first created in 2000, 
then sold to the market in 2001. It is known for it's volume 
knob on the right, it's orange LED, and 
it's siren. It is also pretty rare to obtain 
(unless you wanna pay 500 dollars for it).
